title: Watching the Virus, Minneapolis Confronts Its Deep Inequality, Protests Are About Poverty
itunes:title: Watching the Virus, Minneapolis Confronts Its Deep Inequality, Protests Are About Poverty
description:
Bloomberg Intelligence Chief Equity Strategist Gina Martin Adams and Bloomberg Stocks Editor Dave Wilson set the Businessweek Agenda and check the markets. Dr. Rod Hochman, President and CEO of Providence Health, provides an update on the coronavirus outbreak and the search for a vaccine. Bloomberg Businessweek Editor Joel Weber and Businessweek Economics Editor Peter Coy explain that despite its egalitarian image, Minneapolis has never managed to root out racial inequity. John Hope Bryant, Founder and CEO of Operation Hope, discusses what he sees as the root of the nationwide protests over the death of George Floyd. Bloomberg New Economy Editorial Director Andy Browne talks about how China is calling President Trump’s bluff on Hong Kong. And we Drive to the Close with Emily Roland, Co-Chief Investment Strategist at John Hancock Investment Management.

Hosts: Carol Massar and Jason Kelly. Producer: Paul Brennan. 

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.
